numbered_ace_sentences: 2. I notice a difference between young men and young women in the survey.
3. Young men in the survey reach out to parents less than young women in the survey.
4. The disparity between men and women is large.
5. I wonder how representative these results are for young men and young women.
6. The data was gathered via an online survey.
7. The online survey happened over a relatively short time frame.
8. I think that the results might not be generalizable to young men and young women in general.
10. The results may be not generalizable.
11. Knowing these statistics about the strength of relationships between a parent and a child is useful knowledge.
12. There is much information about mental health issues in young adults.
13. A person can cross-reference this data with mental-health information.
14. Cross-referencing this data with mental-health information can give insights into broader issues.
15. The title is: "Screen Age: How electronics have impacted parental communication".
